result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Nicholas Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher Nicholas Rivera is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher Nicholas Rivera was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Christopher Nicholas Rivera was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterer's Intervention" counseling.
Complete a parenting class.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on 1-23-15.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Nicholas Rivera in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $870 entered as ordered by the court on 11/05/14 to pay $60.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 02/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and filed.  Copies sent to parties.  rmm
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 10/01/14. AR

Defendant Christopher Nicholas Rivera in court with attorney Joel Mogren.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 18 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 6:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served. 
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 1/23/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm
On motion of the defense, Court ordered the GPS removed.  All other conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Christopher Nicholas Rivera in court with attorney Joel Mogren.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNTS 1,3,4,5,7,8:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered charges dismissed.
.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 6:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  The 9/08/14 jury trial is vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm
The court orders the no contact order modified to allow a visitation on 08/15/2014 to Arlington Cemetery for no more than three hours.

Defendant Christopher Nicholas Rivera in court with attorney Joel Mogren.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court grants adjournment of final pre-trial.  Court grants State motion to dismiss count 8.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Pre-Trial Motions: Dismiss Count 8 As It Is Not transcationally Related to the Complaint; Motion to Dismiss Count 8: Franks-Mann received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Defendant Christopher Nicholas Rivera in court with attorney Lucas Kaster for attorney Joel Mogren.  Michael D Thurston appeared for Molly Schmidt for the State of Wisconsin.  
Br. 4 for Br. 40.  
 For the reasons as stated on the record, Court appoints Joel Mogren as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour. Defendant Christopher Nicholas Rivera in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Christopher Nicholas Rivera in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
